rmk: 2 Little Spiderhunters foraging together. Seemed like only one of them was calling, but not 100% certain. Noise reduction carried out.

loc: Dairy Farm Nature Park, Singapore
rmk:
Noise reduction carried out.
Two note pui-pu calls are Little Spiderhunters. The melodic and metallic calls both from Greater Racket-tailed Drongos. One note "ehh" from a Banded Woodpecker.

loc: Rainforest Discovery Centre, Sandakan, Sabah
file-name: XC398561-162 Tailorbird - Rufous-tailed (Orthotomus s. sericeus) Song DEC 0940h 50m TarsierCrossingRDCSepilok_GI_0195.mp3
rmk: Initially incorrectly identified as Rufous-tailed Tailorbird as the voice seemed a bit low. However, there was a lack of other uniquely tailorbird vocalisations. The cadence is that of LISP and this recording is a good match to other individuals in the same location:  XC96677 and XC96678.

Rainforest Discovery Center, Forest Trail, Sepilok, Sandakan, Sabah
rmk: An actual song! or about as close as this species gets. Given from about two meters off the ground in forest understory while following another bird, possible female. Seemed little interested in feeding as it just followed the other bird round till the other flew off and he took off after it in hot pursuit. I was about two meters or less away from this bird at the time.
